summary: Cyber guidance website to educate users about cyber scams/bank transaction fraud and provide help/reporting guidance, with user accounts and scam listing/reporting, built with HTML/CSS/JavaScript frontend and Python or Node.js backend.
architectural_notes: Backend: Python or Node.js (final choice TBD).
Site includes authentication (login/register) and a scam reporting/listing feature backed by server storage.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Minimal cyber safety emblem/logo with shield + circuit lines (cyber-logo.dim_512x512.png)
- Wide hero illustration showing abstract secure banking + warning symbols in a warm non-blue palette (hero-cyber-guidance.dim_1600x900.png)

existing_features.title: Create a multi-page cyber guidance website with the following user-facing sections: (1) Home page explaining the site purpose, (2) Scam Guidance section that educates users about common cyber scams and bank-transaction fraud, (3) "What to do / How to help" guidance section with clear steps for victims and helpers, and (4) a Scam Reports section where users can submit and view scam incidents (what type of scam happened).

Implement user authentication UI with a dedicated Login/Register page and logged-in state, using the platform-supported identity mechanism, and gate scam report submission so only signed-in users can submit new reports.

Create a Scam Reports feature where signed-in users can submit a scam incident including: scam type (selected from predefined categories), short title, description, approximate date, and optional loss amount; and all users can browse a list of submitted reports with basic filtering by scam type.

Add a consistent, distinctive visual theme suitable for a student cyber guidance project (avoid default/unstyled look): define a cohesive color palette (not blue/purple), typography hierarchy, spacing, and components (cards, nav, forms) and apply it across all pages.

Add a Resources section (within the Guidance or Help page) that lists general-purpose items users can use to get help: what evidence to collect, how to contact their bank, and how to find official cybercrime reporting channels for their region (without hardcoding country-specific phone numbers unless provided by the user).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create core site pages: Home, Login/Register, and Scam List/Report page (select/type scam experienced)
Provide cyber scam guidance content: scam types, bank transaction safety tips, and what to do if victimized
Add “how to help people/report cyber crime” guidance section (steps, resources, contacts)
Implement backend (Python or Node.js) to support authentication and storing/retrieving scam reports/list entries

Implement backend storage and retrieval for scam reports, including associating each report with the submitting user identity and a server-side timestamp; provide APIs for creating a report and listing reports (with optional scam-type filter).

projectName: Cyber Guidance Website with Scam Education, User Login, and Scam Reports
